title: Searchers of Slavic Roots of Identity
participants: Young participants from North Macedonia, Bulgaria, Serbia and Croatia
description: An international youth exchange in Poland focused on exploring Slavic history, culture, and shared identity.
fullDescription:
The project “Searchers of Slavic Roots of Identity” took place from 24 to 31 August 2024 in Łuków, Poland, as part of the Erasmus+ programme. Young people from North Macedonia, Bulgaria, Serbia, and Croatia came together to explore their shared Slavic heritage and strengthen intercultural understanding.

The programme began with integration activities and a traditional harvest celebration, symbolizing gratitude and new beginnings. Throughout the exchange, participants visited ethnographic and historical museums in Kozłówka, Łuków, Lublin, and Warsaw, gaining first-hand insight into Polish history, daily life, customs, and traditions across different eras.

In addition to educational visits, the project included sports, recreational activities, discussions, and team-building games. These experiences helped participants build friendships, develop teamwork skills, and contribute to a culture of peace, mutual respect, and unity within a multicultural European context.
objectives: To explore and understand shared Slavic cultural roots
To promote intercultural dialogue and tolerance among young people
To strengthen European identity and a culture of peace
results: Increased knowledge of Slavic history and cultural heritage
New international friendships and partnerships established
Greater awareness of cultural diversity and shared values
